Steps:

     - Read n
     - Read n integers into an array
     - Sort the array (using a quick sort routine we write)
     - Compute c
     - Convert c to string s1 (without spaces)
     - Run the second program on s1 to get res2
     - Convert res2 to string s2
     - Run the third program on s2 to get res3
     - Print res3

   We'll write the program in Fortran 90 style. Let's code accordingly. Note: We must be cautious with the indices and with the modulo arithmetic. We'll write:

     program combined
     implicit none

     ! For the first program
     integer :: n, i, c, temp, stat
     integer, allocatable :: arr(:)
     character(len=20) :: str1, str2
     integer :: res2, MOD1, MOD3
     integer :: res3

     ! For the second program
     integer :: n2, j, M
     integer, allocatable :: dp2(:,:)   ! dp2(0:n2, 0:1)
     character(len=:), allocatable :: str1_trimmed

     ! For the third program
     integer :: n3, base, i_step, pos, next_digit, pre, new_rem
     integer, dimension(0:12) :: prev, current
     character(len=:), allocatable :: str2_trimmed

     ! Step 0: set moduli
     MOD1 = 1000000007   ! for the second program
     MOD3 = 1000000007   ! for the third program

     ! Step 1: Read n and the list
     read(*,*) n
     allocate(arr(n)) do i = 1, n
         read(*,*) arr(i)
     end do

     ! Step 2: Sort the array (using a quick sort)
     call quicksort(arr, 1, n)

     ! Step 3: Compute c
     c = 1
     do i = 1, n
         if (arr(i) >= c) then
             c = c + 1
         end if
     end do

     ! Step 4: Convert c to string
     write(str1, '(I0)') c
     str1_trimmed = trim(str1)
     n2 = len(str1_trimmed)

     ! Step 5: Run the second program on str1_trimmed

     ! Allocate dp2(0:n2, 0:1) -> indices: from 0 to n2, and 0:1
     allocate(dp2(0:n2, 0:1))
     dp2(0,0) = 1
     dp2(0,1) = 0

     do i = 1, n2
         if (str1_trimmed(i:i) == '0') then
             dp2(i,0) = dp2(i-1,0)
             dp2(i,1) = dp2(i-1,1)
         else
             dp2(i,1) = mod(dp2(i-1,0) + dp2(i-1,1), MOD1)

        ! Quick sort subroutine for integers
        recursive subroutine quicksort(arr, low, high)
            integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
            integer, intent(in) :: low, high
            integer :: i, j, pivot, temp

            if (low < high) then
                pivot = arr(high)
                i = low - 1
                do j = low, high-1
                    if (arr(j) <= pivot) then
                        i = i + 1
                        temp = arr(i)
                        arr(i) = arr(j)
                        arr(j) = temp
                    end if
                end do
                temp = arr(i+1)
                arr(i+1) = arr(high)
                arr(high) = temp

                call quicksort(arr, low, i)
                call quicksort(arr, i+2, high)
            end if
        end subroutine quicksort

     end program combined
